moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d5: I've only recently stated exploring the Elephant Gambit.
moves.3. Nxe5 Bd6 4. Nd3 dxe4 5. Qe2 Qe7 6. f3:
I've never attempted a Two Bishop Mate before.
62. ... fxg4 would have made things easier for me.
I wanted to have a "pure" Two Bishops Mate with no other men on the board.
In retrospect I could have just promoted my third Pawn (to a Rook or Queen) and then forced White to take it.
I was completely willing to risk the easy mate I could have had by getting a Queen for a chance to attempt the Two Bishops.
moves.63. gxf5:
I'm a little uneasy now as I'm not absolutely confident I'll be able to stop the f-Pawn.
I thought I might not have merely have thrown away a win but also any chance at a draw!

If I can't work out how to do it within 50 Moves I'll be stuck with a Draw.
